title: Anglesey Family Adventure
tagline: Island adventures for all the family on Wales' beautiful Isle of Anglesey
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8 and up who enjoy outdoor activities and are comfortable with easy physical exertion. Also suitable for active grandparents.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility or a strong aversion to water activities. Very young children (under 5) may find some activities challenging.

stops.title: Family Sea Kayaking
stops.description: Explore the Anglesey coastline from sit-on-top kayaks - perfect for families and beginners. Guided sessions take you along sheltered bays, past sea caves, and hopefully seal sightings. All equipment provided including wetsuits and buoyancy aids. Sessions adapt to conditions and group ability.

alternativeOperators.name: Sea Kayaking Wales
alternativeOperators.notes: British Canoeing courses, opened kayak centre Sept 2024

stops.insiderTip: Book the morning session - winds often pick up in the afternoon. Sit-on-top kayaks are very stable and easy for kids to reboard if they fall off. Bring water and a snack.

wetAlt.title: Anglesey Sea Zoo
wetAlt.description: All-weather family attraction with local marine life, shark tunnel, and outdoor activities. Seals, lobsters, seahorses and more. Kids love the touch pools.

budgetAlt.title: Rockpooling at Rhoscolyn
budgetAlt.description: Free morning exploring the fantastic rock pools at Rhoscolyn. Look for crabs, anemones, and small fish. Best 1-2 hours after low tide.

stops.title: The Oyster Catcher
stops.description: Gastropub overlooking Rhosneigr beach with excellent family menu. Fresh local seafood, hearty pub classics, and kids' portions. Great outdoor terrace for sunny days. Dog-friendly too.
stops.insiderTip: Book a table if visiting at weekend lunchtime - it gets busy. The fish and chips are excellent.

alternative.title: The Bay Cafe (Rhosneigr)
alternative.description: Casual beachfront cafe with sandwiches, burgers, and ice cream. Kid-friendly and quick.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic on Rhosneigr Beach
budgetAlt.description: Pick up supplies from the village shop and picnic on the sand. There's also a chip shop for takeaway.

stops.title: Llanddwyn Island Coastal Walk
stops.description: Walk to magical Llanddwyn Island through Newborough Forest and across beautiful sandy beaches. The 'island' is accessible on foot except at very high tides. See the lighthouse (Tŵr Mawr), St Dwynwen's cross, and pilot cottages. Perfect for little explorers.
stops.costNote: Free access, parking £5-8 at Newborough Beach
stops.insiderTip: Walk through Newborough Forest for the shade, then emerge onto the vast beach. The island is named after St Dwynwen, the Welsh patron saint of lovers. At low tide you can walk all the way around.

wetAlt.title: Foel Farm Park
wetAlt.description: Working farm with hands-on animal feeding, tractor rides, and play areas. Perfect for younger kids on a rainy day.

budgetAlt.title: Beach afternoon at Newborough
budgetAlt.description: Skip Llanddwyn and just enjoy the vast sandy beach at Newborough. Great for sandcastles and paddling.

stops.title: Beaumaris Area Self-Catering
stops.description: Stay near Beaumaris for easy access to tomorrow's boat trip. Plenty of family cottages, B&Bs, and guesthouses in this charming castle town. Walk to fish and chips and ice cream!

recommendedOptions.name: Liverpool Arms Hotel
recommendedOptions.note: Family-friendly pub with rooms right on the seafront

recommendedOptions.name: Castle Court Hotel
recommendedOptions.note: Comfortable family rooms near the castle

stops.insiderTip: Stay in Beaumaris itself if possible - the evening stroll along the seafront with ice cream is a lovely end to the day. Plenty of restaurants for family dinner.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Llanfaes
budgetAlt.description: Family campsite just outside Beaumaris. Basic but convenient and great value.

stops.title: Puffin Island Boat Trip
stops.description: Boat trip from Beaumaris Pier to Puffin Island to see the famous puffin colony (best June-July), grey seals hauled out on rocks, and cormorants. 1.5-hour circular trip with commentary. Keep cameras ready!

requirements.note: Not landing on island, just circling

stops.seasonalNote: Puffins are present late April to early August. Peak season is June. Outside puffin season, you'll still see seals and seabirds.
stops.insiderTip: Book the first trip of the day for calmer seas and more active wildlife. Puffins are most visible in June-July. Bring binoculars and warm layers even on sunny days - it's cooler at sea.

wetAlt.title: Beaumaris Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore this impressive UNESCO World Heritage castle. Unfinished but fascinating - kids love the walls and towers. Medieval re-enactments sometimes run in summer.

budgetAlt.title: Beaumaris Pier Walk
budgetAlt.description: Free walk along the pier with views to Puffin Island, the Menai Strait, and Snowdonia across the water.

stops.title: Fish & Chips in Beaumaris
stops.description: Grab fish and chips from one of Beaumaris's excellent chippies and eat on the pier or green. Classic British seaside experience!

alternative.title: Red Boat Ice Cream Parlour
alternative.description: Famous Anglesey ice cream parlour. Grab a cone after fish and chips!

budgetAlt.title: Supermarket picnic
budgetAlt.description: Pick up lunch from the Co-op and eat on the green by the castle.

stops.title: South Stack Cliffs & RSPB Reserve
stops.description: Visit the dramatic South Stack lighthouse headland - one of Wales' most spectacular viewpoints. The RSPB reserve has thousands of nesting seabirds (spring/summer) including puffins, guillemots, and razorbills. Ellin's Tower visitor centre has telescopes and knowledgeable staff.

rspbInfo.note: The 400 steps down to the lighthouse are worth it but challenging for little legs. Main clifftop views don't require the descent.

stops.insiderTip: The cafe at Ellin's Tower is excellent. RSPB volunteers often have telescopes trained on nesting birds - free guided viewing! The lighthouse tours run in summer if you want to go inside (book ahead).

wetAlt.title: Pili Palas Nature World
wetAlt.description: Tropical butterfly house and animal encounters - snakes, meerkats, and more. All-weather family attraction near Menai Bridge.

budgetAlt.title: Clifftop walk only
budgetAlt.description: Walk the clifftops without descending to the lighthouse. Still spectacular views and free apart from parking.

standard.notes: Based on 2 adults + 2 children, self-catering apartment

budget.notes: Camping, one paid activity, packed lunches, free beaches

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Anglesey has a mild maritime climate but can be unpredictable. Pack layers and waterproofs. Sea trips can be bumpy - bring seasickness remedies if prone. Boat trips may be cancelled in bad weather.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: The A55 can be congested, especially at the Britannia Bridge. Allow extra time on summer weekends. Parking at popular beaches (Newborough, Rhosneigr) fills early on sunny days - arrive before 10am.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Boat trips to Puffin Island MUST be booked in advance, especially in puffin season (June-July). Kayaking also needs advance booking. Accommodation books up fast for summer holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary is designed for families with children 8+. The coastal walk to Llanddwyn is about 3 miles return on sand (easy). South Stack has 400 steps to the lighthouse (optional - views from top are still great).
knowBeforeYouGo.puffins: Puffins are only on Anglesey from late April to early August. Peak viewing is June-July. Outside this season, you'll see seals and other seabirds instead.
knowBeforeYouGo.menaiCrossings: Two crossings from mainland: Britannia Bridge (A55, carries trains) and Menai Suspension Bridge (A5, older but scenic). Britannia is usually faster but check for roadworks.

addDay.title: Add Zip World Fforest (Betws-y-Coed)
addDay.description: 30min drive to the mainland for Zip World Fforest - tree-top adventures, Fforest Coaster, and the Plummet. Great for adventurous families.

alternative.title: RIB Ride Adventure
alternative.description: Swap the kayaking for a high-speed RIB ride around the Anglesey coast. Thrilling wildlife spotting for older kids.
